newsitem.title: USA: Meridian Q2 falls on increased spending.
newsitem.headline: Meridian Q2 falls on increased spending.

text.p: Meridian Resource Corp said Tuesday higher spending cut its second quarter net income to $1.2 million, or $0.08 per share, from $1.5 million or $0.10 per share in the same period a year earlier.
In a statement accompanying earnings, Meridian attributed the spending increase to higher output and increased exploration.
Net income for the first half was $3.3 million, $0.21 per share, up from $2.9 million, $0.19 per share, a year ago.
Revenues increased rose 23 percent to $6.9 million from $5.6 million a year ago and by 42 percent in the first half $15.2 million from $10.7 million.

In a statement accompanying its earnings, the company said oil production for the second quarter rose 81 percent from a year ago to 172,000 barrels from the year ago quarter and natural gas production rose 24 percent to 1.558 billion cubic feet.
The company said that it intends to spud five wells at its East Cameron Main Pass, Stella, Monte Carlo and Rivera prospects by year end.
Meridian stock was unchanged at 10-3/16 by 1045 EDT. ((-- David Chance New York Newsroom 212 859 1902))
